text: The Tasman Sea is the sea between Australia and New Zealand. It was named after Dutch explorer Abel Tasman. It is about across, and from north to south. The sea is part of the south Pacific Ocean. Its Māori name is Te Tai-o-Rēhua, and it is sometimes called The Ditch by Australians and New Zealanders. Category:Seas of the Pacific Ocean Category:Bodies of water of Oceania Category:Bodies of water of Australia Category:Geography of New Zealand
title: Tasman Sea
